32a9dfb5-737d-4301-99e8-ac75fcfb31f8.plaintext: The systematic monitoring of Bio-geophysical Parameters produces a series of qualified bio-geophysical products on the status and evolution of the land surface. The products are used to monitor vegetation, crops, water cycle, energy budget and terrestrial cryosphere variables. For easier reference these products are grouped in five thematic blocks: Soil Moisture, Snow, Vegetation, Temperature and Reflectance and Water Bodies.

children.text: The systematic monitoring of Bio-geophysical Parameters produces a series of qualified bio-geophysical products on the status and evolution of the land surface. The products are used to monitor vegetation, crops, water cycle, energy budget and terrestrial cryosphere variables. For easier reference these products are grouped in five thematic blocks: Soil Moisture, Snow, Vegetation, Temperature and Reflectance and Water Bodies.

87a94366-25b5-4f57-b9ef-ace2ff54dda6.plaintext: The European Ground Motion Service (EGMS) provides consistent and reliable information regarding natural and anthropogenic ground motion over the Copernicus participating states and across national borders, with millimeter accuracy.

children.text: The European Ground Motion Service (EGMS) provides consistent and reliable information regarding natural and anthropogenic ground motion over the Copernicus participating states and across national borders, with millimeter accuracy.

5af45aa4-d09b-434e-8952-066d4edbc009.plaintext: Priority Area Monitoring aims to provide tailored and more detailed land cover and land use information on specific areas of interest, often called hot-spots. Hotspots in the context of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service are areas prone to specific environmental challenges.

afc0a00b-c65f-4576-9ad1-796c0c1cb402.plaintext: The products of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service are organised into several components as provided below.

children.text: The products of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service are organised into several components as provided below.

7e226914-5962-43a7-9fad-f8a24edabffb.plaintext: Land Cover and Land Use Mapping produces land cover classifications at various level of detail, both within a pan-European and global context. At the pan-European level, these are complemented by detailed layers on land cover characteristics, such as imperviousness, forests, grassland, water and wetness and small woody features. At global level, the land cover mapping follows the FAO's modular-hierarchical Land Cover Classification System.

children.text: Land Cover and Land Use Mapping produces land cover classifications at various level of detail, both within a pan-European and global context. At the pan-European level, these are complemented by detailed layers on land cover characteristics, such as imperviousness, forests, grassland, water and wetness and small woody features. At global level, the land cover mapping follows the FAO's modular-hierarchical Land Cover Classification System.

b7c09dc1-7be5-480a-8f19-9e05679acdf5.plaintext: Satellite Data comprise image mosaics from contributing missions covering the territory of Europe as well as Sentinel-2 image mosaic production at global level.

Ground-based observations for Validations: Land products for validation

c1b215dd-837d-4bfe-82a8-7af09a4881f8.plaintext: Reference and Validation Data covers reference datasets providing homogeneous pan-European coverage of some key geospatial themes, such as hydrography and elevation, and in situ measurements collected at global scale to validate core products of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service.

children.text: Reference and Validation Data covers reference datasets providing homogeneous pan-European coverage of some key geospatial themes, such as hydrography and elevation, and in situ measurements collected at global scale to validate core products of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service.

Here you can find information about the thematic scope of the products, consult technical documentation, register to user workshops, learn about new and planned updates. You can also easily access the datasets available for each product, but:

children.text: In this section you can explore the CLMS portfolio product by product. Here you can find information about the thematic scope of the products, consult technical documentation, register to user workshops, learn about new and planned updates. You can also easily access the datasets available for each product, but:

8dcb27da-fd39-4b96-bc38-2e500893ae28.plaintext: the main point of access to CLMS data and metadata is CLMS Dataset catalogue .

children.text: the main point of access to CLMS data and metadata is

f958af0d-f8f6-4cc8-a6ca-3c0a02683e55.plaintext: In this section we will inform you about new products and services of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service.

children.text: In this section we will inform you about new products and services of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service.

items.description: The Dynamic Land Cover product provides a primary land cover scheme at three classification levels with class definitions according to the Land Cover Classification System (LCCS) scheme. The product is produced annually, and the actual version of the product (V3.0) is available for the 2015-2019 reference years.
items.title: Dynamic Land Cover

items.description: CORINE Land Cover is a pan-European land cover inventory with 44 thematic classes. Initiated in 1985 (the 1990 reference year) the inventory is available  for the 1990, 2000, 2006, 2012 and 2018 reference years including change layers 1990-2000, 2006-2012 and 2012-2018.
items.title: CORINE Land Cover

items.description: The CLC+ Backbone product provides a detailed pan-European wall to wall geometric vector reference layer with 18 basic thematic classes and a 11-class 10 m spatial resolution raster product. The product has a three years update cycle and is available for the 2018 reference year.
items.title: CLC+Backbone

items.description: The High Resolution Layer Imperviousness product at pan-European level captures the spatial distribution of artificially sealed areas including the level of sealing of the soil per area unit. The product has a three years cycle and is available for the 2006, 2009, 2012, 2015 and 2018 reference years including change layers available for 2006-2009, 2009-2012, 2012-2015, 2015-2018, and in addition a change layer available for 2006-2012 and aligned with the CORINE Land Cover periodicity.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Imperviousness

items.description: The High Resolution Layer Impervious Built-up product at pan-European level provides information about areas where above-ground building constructions can be found. The product is available for the 2018 reference year and is complemented with the aggregated Share of Built-up dataset showing the percentage of built-up areas across Europe.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Impervious Built-up

items.description: The High Resolution Layer Dominant Leaf Type product at pan-European level provides information on the dominant leaf type: broadleaved or coniferous. The product has a three years update cycle and is available for the 2012, 2015 and 2018 reference year including the change layer showing increase or decrease of leaf type mask between 2015 and 2018.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Dominant Leaf Type

items.description: The High Resolution Layer Forest Tree Type at pan-European level provides one type of forest products according to the forest definition of the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO). It has a three years update cycle and is available for the 2012, 2015 and 2018 reference year.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Forest Type

items.description: The High Resolution Tree Cover Density at pan-European level provides the level of tree cover density in a range from 0-100%.  The product has a three years update cycle and is available for the 2012, 2015 and 2018 reference years including the change product showing increase or decrease of tree cover mask in 2012 - 2015 and 2015 - 2018.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Tree Cover Density

items.description: The High Resolution Layer Grassland is a binary product at pan-European level providing a grassland/non-grassland mask. It has a three years update cycle and is available for the 2015 and 2018 reference years including the change layer.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Grassland

items.description: The combined High Resolution Layer Water and Wetness product at pan-European level shows the occurrence of water and wet surfaces over the period from 2009 to 2018.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Water and  Wetness

items.description: The High Resolution Layer Small Woody Features product at pan-European level provides harmonized information on linear structures such as hedgerows, as well as patches of woody features. It has a three years update cycle and is available for the 2015 and 2018 reference years including the change layer.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Small Woody Features

items.description: The Coastal Zones product provides detailed land cover and land use information for 71 thematic classes for all European coastal territory to a landward distance of 10 km with total area mapped of approximately 730,000 km². The product has a six years update cycle and is now available for the 2012 and 2018 reference years with the 2012-2018 change layer.
items.title: Coastal Zones

items.description: The N2K product provides detailed land cover and land use information for 55 thematic classes in a large number (4.790) of grassland rich Natura 2000 sites including a 2 km buffer zone. The product has a six years update cycle and is available for the 2006, 2012 and 2018 reference years including the change layers.
items.title: N2K

items.description: The Riparian Zones product provides detailed information on the state and characteristics for 55 thematic classes of riparian zones across Europe in a variable buffer zone of selected rivers (Strahler levels 2-9 derived from EU-Hydro). The product has a six years update cycle and is available for the 2012 and 2018 reference years including the change layer.
items.title: Riparian Zones

items.description: The Urban Atlas provides pan-European comparable land cover and land use information for the selected Functional Urban Areas (FUA) in Europe and the United Kingdom. The product has a six years update cycle and is available for the 2006, 2012 and 2018 reference years including the change layers. For the 2012 and 2018 reference years a derived from FUAs separate Street Tree Layer is available, and for the 2012 reference year the product suite is complemented with Building Height information. The number of urban thematic classes covered in Urban Atlas is 17 for all reference years, and the number of rural classes from 2 in the 2006 reference year increased to 10 in the 2012 and 2018 reference years.
items.title: Urban Atlas

items.description: The High Resolution Copernicus Hot Spot Monitoring (HSM) activity delivers land cover and land cover change products on Key Landscapes for Conservation (KLC) and Protected Areas (PA), with an initial emphasis on the African continent, which are characterized by pronounced anthropogenic pressures that require high mapping accuracy. The products are based on medium to high and very high resolution images (from approximately 1 m to 30 m spatial resolution) with a change assessment frequency between 1 to 20 years.
items.title: Reference Land Cover and Land Cover Change in selected Hot Spots

items.description: The Snow and Ice parameters product suite provides data about snow properties on land and ice occurrences in the hydrographic network. At pan-European level the Snow and Ice parameters are available at high resolution (20 m, 60 m). These high resolution Snow and Ice parameters are mostly disseminated in near real time, with the temporal extent from September 2016 to present. Across the Northern Hemisphere the Snow and Ice parameters are provided in near real time at lower level of details (the spatial resolution varies from 250 m to 5 km).  The temporal extent of these medium to low resolution Snow and Ice parameters also varies: the Snow Water Equivalent has the temporal extent from January 2006 to present, and the Lake Ice Extent and the Snow Cover Extent have the temporal extent from March 2017 to present.
items.title: Snow
DEPRECATED - Low Resolution Snow and Ice Parameters

items.description: High-Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity parameters at pan-European level provide three product groups: daily vegetation indices, 10-daily seasonal trajectories and annual vegetation phenology and productivity parameters. The complete product suite is operational since January 2017 onwards.
items.title: High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity Parameters

items.description: EU-Hydro at pan-European level provides a photo-interpreted river network, consistent of surface interpretation of water bodies (lakes and wide rivers), and a drainage model (also called Drainage Network), derived from EU-DEM, with catchments and drainage lines and nodes.
items.title: EU-Hydro

items.description: The Ground-Based Observations for Validation (GBOV) service provides multiple years of high quality in-situ measurements and derived land products to validate key bio-physical parameters at global scale produced by the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (Top-of-canopy reflectances, Surface Albedo, Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation, Leaf Area Index, Fraction of green Vegetation Cover, Land Surface Temperature and Soil Moisture).
items.title: Ground-Based Observations for Validation

items.description: European Image Mosaic provides a seamless pan-European ortho-rectified mosaic processed from individual satellite image scenes. European Image Mosaic has a three years update cycle and in high resolution is available for the 2006, 2009, 2012, 2015 and 2018 reference years. In very high resolution European image mosaic is available only for the 2012 and 2018 reference years (due to data availability and quality issues).
items.title: European Image Mosaic

parent.description: We provide geographical information on land cover and its changes, land use, ground motion, vegetation state, water cycle and earth surface energy variables for both Europe and the entire globe.
parent.title: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service
